alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 11:05PM EDT until May 02 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Sagadahoc and Kennebec Counties. Carrabassett River At North Anson affecting Franklin and Somerset Counties. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Carrabassett River...including North Anson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Hallowell. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Parking lots along Front Street begin to flood. Town dock begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water enters the back side of buildings along Water Street. Front Street becomes completely submerged. The parking lot by town dock flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:35 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 13.8 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
